head.note: This manuscript record does not have a summary list of contents. For composite manuscripts, the list of contents can be found under each individual part.

listRelation.desc: This composite manuscript consists of 6 distinct parts:

head.note: This manuscript contains: Jacob of Batnae. Metrical discourses ofJacobofBatnae. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 5 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Metrical discourses of Jacob of Batnae
The fourth discourse on the End of the World
msItem.rubric: ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܐܪ̈ܒܥܐ ܕܥܠ ܚܪܬܐ. ܕܐܡܝܪ ܠܡܪܝ ܝܥܩܘܒ ܡܠܦܢܐ ܕܫܪܪܐ.
msItem.note: A small portion of the conclusion alone remains.

msItem.title: On Drunkards
msItem.incipit: ܡܠܦܢܘܬܐ ܐܝܟ ܐܣܝܬܐ ܗܝ ܠܕܫ̇ܡܥ ܠܗ̇. ܪ̈ܚܡܝ ܚ̈ܝܐ ܠܐ ܬܫܘܛܘܢܗ̇ ܠܡܫܒܚܬܐ. ܏ܘܫ..

msItem.title: On the Youth who asked our Lord, What shall I do that I may inherit eternal life?
msItem.rubric: ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܥܠ ܗ̇ܘ ܥܠܝܡܐ ܕܐܦܝܣ ܠܡܪܢ. ܕܡܢܐ ܐܥܒܕ ܕܐܝܪܬ ܚܝ̈ܐ ܕܠܥܠܡ..

msItem.title: That the Lawgiver of the Old and New Testaments is one
msItem.rubric: ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܡܚܘܐ ܕܚܕ , ܗܘ ܣܐܡ ܢܡܘܣܐ̇. ܕܥܬܝܩܬܐ ܘܕܚܕܬܐ,
msItem.incipit: ܐܕܝܠ ܒܝ ܡܪܝ ܡܠܬܐ ܕܡܠܝܐ ܟܠ ܝܘܬܪ̈ܢܐ. ܘܙܡܪܐ ܫܘܒܚܟ ܒܟܢܘ̈ܫܬܟ ܥܬܝܪܐܝܬ.
msItem.note: See Assemani, Bibl. Or., t. i., p. 319, no. 102.

physDesc.p: Vellum, 8 3/4 in. by 5 3/8, consisting of 18 leaves, with from 23 to 25 lines in each page. There is a considerable lacuna after fol. 10.

item.p: There is a considerable lacuna after fol. 10.

layout.p: 18 leaves with from 23 to 25 lines in each page

handDesc.handNote: This manuscript is written in a good, regular hand of the viith cent.

head.note: This manuscript contains: Mark the Monk. Portions of the discourse of Marcus the monk on the Spiritual Law. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 item.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Portions of the discourse of Marcus the monk on the Spiritual Law.
msItem.note: See Assemani, Bibl. Or., t. iii., pars 1, p. 45 ; Gallandii Bibl. Vett. Patrum, t. viii., p. 1 ; Migne, Patrol. Gr., t. lxv., col. 905

physDesc.p: Five vellum leaves, about 8 5/8 in. by 5 3/8, all more or less stained and the last much mutilated (Add. 17,160, foll. 19—23 ). Each page is divided into two columns of 29 or 30 lines.

item.p: All of the leaves are more or less stained and the last much mutilated.
There are lacunae after foll.19 and 21.

layout.p: Each page is divided into two columns of 29 or 30 lines.

handDesc.handNote: The writing is a good, regular Estrangělā of the vith or viith cent.

physDesc.p: Three vellum leaves, about 8 5/8 in. by 5 1/4, the second and third of which are much torn (Add. 17,160, foll. 24—26 ). Each page is divided into two columns, of from 28 to 36 lines.

item.p: The second and third of the leaves are much torn.

layout.p: Each page is divided into two columns, of from 28 to 36 lines.

handDesc.handNote: The writing is good and regular, of about the viiith cent.

head.note: This manuscript contains: . In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 4 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Part of the Order of the Consecration of a bishop, etc.
Prayers to be used at the consecration of a bishop
msItem.rubric: . . [ܐ]ܩܘܠܘܬܝܐ ܕܨ̈ܠܘܬܐ . . . ܐܦܝܣܩܘܦܐ ܟܠ . . . ܛܟܣܗ ܕܩܕܝܫܐ . . . ـܢܘܣ ܐܦܝܣܩܘܦܐ . . ܡܢ ܛܟ̈ܣܐ . . . ܥܕ̈ܬܢܝܐ ܡܛܠ . . . ܣـ ܕܐܦܝ̈ܣܩܘܦܐ

physDesc.p: Two vellum leaves, about 8 1/8 in. by 5 1/4, slightly soiled and mutilated (Add. 17,160, foll. 29, 30 ). Each page is divided into two columns, of from 26 to 34 lines.

item.p: Two vellum leaves slightly soiled and mutilated.

layout.p: Each page is divided into two columns, of from 26 to 34 lines.

handDesc.handNote: The writing varies from a fine, regular Estrạngĕlā to a more cursive character. They are dated A. Gr. 1100, A.D. 789.See additions.

item.label: Colophon
item.p: The colophon, fol. 30a, which is mutilated, gives the date and the name of the scribe, Ḥabīb or Agapêtos).

p.quote: . . . ܬܒ ܦܢܩܝܬܐ ܕܩܫܝܫܐ ܡܫܡܠܝܬܐ ܚܬܝܬܐܝܬ . . . ܕܐܦܝܣܩܘܦܐ ܟܠܗ: ܫܘܒܚܐ ܠܐܒܐ ܘܠܒܪܐ ܏ܘܫ. [ܐܫܬܠܡـ]ܬ݁ ܦܢܩܝܬܐ ܗܕܐ ܫܢܬ ܐܠܦܐ ܘܡܐܐ [ܕܐܠܟܣܢـ]ܕܪܘܣ: ܒܝܘܡ ܫܒܬܐ: ܒܐܝܪܚ ܚܙܝܪܢ: ܒܬܠܬ ܫ̈ܥܝܢ. [ܟܠ ܕܩ̇ܪܐ] ܒܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ̣. ܢܨ̇ܠܐ ܥܠ ܚܒܝܒ ܟܬܘܒܐ ܒܪ . . . [ܘ]ܐܠܝܫܒܥ. ܕܟܬܒܗ ܗ̣ܘ ܒܐܝ̈ܕܘܗܝ ܠܢܦܫܗ: [ܘܠܝܘܬܪܢܐ] ܕܟܠ ܕܩ̇ܪܐ ܒܗ: ܘܠܥܘܗܕܢܐ ܕܝܠܗ ܘܕܥ̈ܢܝܕܘܗܝ.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.catDesc: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies
Councils of the Church and Ecclesiastical Canons

langUsage.language: Arabic Garshuni in East Syriac script
